Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
lowdown \low"down`\, low-down \low"-down`\n. true confidential information.
Syn: details, dope, poop, inside dope, inside information. [WordNet 1.5]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
lowdown \low"down`\, low-down \low"-down`\n. true confidential information.
Syn: details, dope, poop, inside dope, inside information. [WordNet 1.5]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
lowdown \low"down`\, low-down \low"-down`\a. of the most contemptible kind; contemptible; mean; base; vile; -- of people or the actions of people; as, a lowdown sneak thief.
Syn: abject, base, despicable, low, lowdown, miserable, vile. [WordNet 1.5 + PJC]
2. having the soulful feeling of early blues; -- of jazz.
Syn: funky. [WordNet 1.5 +PJC]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
lowdown \low"down`\, low-down \low"-down`\a. of the most contemptible kind; contemptible; mean; base; vile; -- of people or the actions of people; as, a lowdown sneak thief.
Syn: abject, base, despicable, low, lowdown, miserable, vile. [WordNet 1.5 + PJC]
2. having the soulful feeling of early blues; -- of jazz.
Syn: funky. [WordNet 1.5 +PJC]

low-down adj 1: of the most contemptible kind; "abject cowardice"; "a low stunt to pull"; "a low-down sneak"; "his miserable treatment of his family"; "You miserable skunk!"; "a scummy rabble"; "a scurvy trick" [syn: {abject}, {low}, {miserable}, {scummy}, {scurvy}] 2: (of jazz) having the soulful feeling of early blues [syn: {funky}] n : slang terms for inside information; "is that the straight dope?" [syn: {dope}, {poop}, {the skinny}]
